reviewText:
I have, until now, never seen a game where the entire game being good or bad hinged on a certain section of a certain level. Don't get me wrong, the game up until that point is barely a borderline 5/10 as it is. I tried the demo and thought well the mixed reviews are probably just fanboys hating on it. Turns out the demo is the only good thing about the game. After level 6 it goes downhill bad. This game is sooooo generic. Painfully bad graphics, animations, and the weapons are horrible. There are no hit indicators when you shoot something or it hits you other than your lifebars decreasing. That's it. The beam is good but the yellow wave weapon is bad and the blue single shot weapon is god awful. So the part where this game finally got a quit/uninstall for me was the graveyard, around level 8 or maybe it was 9. The levels are all recycled by the way. You revisit levels throughout the whole game. So in a certain section in that level it swarms you with blue flyers and yellow ground things and you can't move to the edges or yellow hands will down you. It is probably the hardest part of any game I have ever played. I tried probably 30-40 times for an hour then by luck got to the next section. The next section was the same ♥♥♥♥ing thing: getting downed quickly then the rest of the team gets wiped out. I have seen the game over screen in this game more than any game I have ever played. I don't care who you are, you are going to get downed over, and over, and over again. In later levels, good luck ever getting picked up by your teammates. They do way less dmg to enemies than you do and if there are enemies on screen while you are down they most of the time won't pick you up. They can't anyway because one hit stops the pickup bar and thats it, they are basically dead by getting swarmed.

I have never seen the difficulty spike so fast in any game, ever. If you had 4 real people playing that level might be doable. Might be. This may be the hardest game I have ever played and for all the wrong reasons. All of them.

Crushingly generic, without the difficulty spikes into nearly impossible sections without 3 other human players, this game would barely get a 6/10 from me, maybe a 5.5. With those problems considered, it lowers the score for this horrible piece of ♥♥♥♥ down to a 3/10. Pass on this even if it is free.

reviewText:
The Ghostbusters are overworked,  therefore they have to hire some rookies. Those rookies battle a supernatural menace in the form of an ancient demon who comes back to life, bringing with him to New York City hundreds of ghosts.
The tasks are always the same. Walk into a room, get locked into said room and defeat ghosts - repeat. The  mechanics are incredibly broken, the AI is terrible and the mission structure is incredibly backwards.
Graphically, Sanctum of Slime is acceptable but unimpressive. All the items on the screen, from the Ghostbusters to the enemies to the environment, are well-drawn and colorful, but there isn't a whole lot of personality, detail, or realism to the art style.
The sound does not fare much better. The lack of voice acting hurts and the music is repetitive and not memorable. The only good thing, however, is that the original theme song is included.
Sanctum of Slime is a real bad game. If you want to enjoy a good Ghostbusters game you better should check out Ghostbusters: The Videogame. Sanctum of Slime is a sloppy and poorly designed game that looks generations behind where we are now and it is not worth to buy.

Sounds 2/10
Graphics 4/10
Gameplay 2/10
Atmosphere 1/10

If you liked my review, please feel free to follow me and/or my curator group:
http://steamcommunity.com/id/Ov3RT4K3R/myworkshopfiles/?section=guides
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/orcollective#curation

reviewText:
The game is called Ghostbusters but none of the ghostbusters from the movie are in this game, there are cartoons with different groups of ghostbusters, the movies, and even comics with other groups of ghostbusters.  In this game you get NONE of those you get four new generically designed politically correct multiculture pals to play with.  The ghosts repeat themselves, the bellhop ghost makes sense in the hotel level, but what is it doing in the Sewers, or in a sanitarium?  The game feels like its made by third graders, or some comp sci project for an undergrad more than an actual game.

The core mechanic of the game revolves around shooting different colored beams at different colored enemies.  This would be interesting except when all those colors are on screen at once, making the core game mechanic annoying.   No patch, and no bug fix will fix the core game mechanic of the game being annoying.  But hey the game has a high score counter!  in fact your not allowed to finish a mission until you smack the keyboard entering random letters to show off your high score.  Must be made by devs who worked on old atari games because I guess they never got the memo that high scores dont matter in modern games.

Who ya gonna call?  Not these clowns...
Rating:  0/10  Value:  $0.00

reviewText:
Poorly executed top down shooter, painfully linear and perhaps the most difficult game on steam, and that isn't something to be proud of.    This could have been a very good game if the game had more development time and some patches, if it was more of an RPG style shooter, or if the money you earn could actually be spent on weapon upgrades then it would be so much better.

The A.I is terrible,  you don't get nearly enough health before being downed and then it takes far to long to be rescued, on boss fights its pretty much 'game over' and you'll have to start the entire boss fight from scratch resulting in a signficant amount of frustration.   This game desperately needed online co-op to have any form of success.

Its far too linear for its own good, often revisiting the same location with newer and tougher ghosts to kill,  the end of level bosses are exceptionally frustrating and take waay waay too long to weaken, all the time the boss can easily one shot you and your entire team leading to more game over screens -  get used to seeing those game over screens by the way, it happens way too often.

The only saving grace and I mean this scarcastically, is the Ghostbusters comic book style story, and the original Ghostbusters soundtrack - - thats its, the actually gameplay is very poor.   I don't recommend this game unless its part of a sale or bundle.

reviewText:
Micro Review

Overall Score: 7/10

Controls: 9/10
Gameplay: 7/10
Graphics: 6/10
Music/Sound FX: 7/10

Achievements: 12
Levels: 12
Genre: Action/Arcade
Length: 3-5 Hours (100% Story/Collectibles)
Purchased Price: $1.99 (Reg: $9.99)
Recommended Purchase Price: $4.99 or less

Pros:

+ 4-Player Co-op
+ Easy controls
+ Big boss battles in almost every level
+ Offical music and sound fx from Ghostbusters

Cons:

- Can get repetitive
- AI for allies can be annoying, such as blocking your beams and not reviving you when you have fallen

Neutral:

= No voice over or sound fx in comic book cutscenes
= The original Ghostbusters look nothing like themselves in the comic book cutscenes
= A screen clearing weapon or ability would have been nice
= The ability to take over another Ghostbuster when you have fallen would have been a nice option
= A few more levels enviroments, considering they repeat at least once
= Would have been cool to actually drive the Ecto-1

Final Thoughts:

It may not be a proper sequel to Ghosbusters: The Video Game"
recommended: it is an enjoyable duel-stick arcade action game that I believe fans of Ghosbusters will enjoy and anyone who enjoys an arcade style game with 4-player co-op."

reviewText:
I heard this wasn't good, but being a Ghostbusters fan boy since 1984, I decided to give it a look anyway once it was sub-$5. Short version: It's not good.

You play as four Ghostbusters... but not Egon, Ray, Peter, or Winston. Four other Ghostbusters. The game was designed entirely with 4-player multiplayer in mind. On the consoles you could play online, but for PC they decided to remove that feature. Single player means 3 AI partners...

Here's how the game will go. Enemy attacks can knock you down sometimes in a single hit, and you have to wait for one of your partners to help you up. What will happen is that when you go down, then the AI Ghostbuster nearest you goes to help you, and they will be knocked down by that same enemy. Then the third one does the exact same. Then the last AI partner does the exact same thing. Game Over. This will happen every time.

The other Ghostbusters game, however, was excellent... but it's been removed from the Steam store.

reviewText:
Who you gonna call!?  Ghostbusters!!  Is a twin stick shooter and it's pretty damn fun, but one of its major appealing options is also its worst.  Coop.  Yes, it's fun local 4 player couch coop, but nothing is online and that's too bad.

The game has 12 stages in total and even on normal difficulty it can get quite challenging.  You have 3 different weapons at any given time.  Each weapon is color coded toward the enimies you are fighting.  There's Red, Blue, and Yellow guns.  Easily toggled between each other.  And the final weapon is the ghost trap.  These are only usuable on the end of stages bosses.  Who ever throws the trap out gets a mini quick time event challenge in order to trap the ghost.  It's not hard and it awards the player with more points.

Each stages story progresses from the last in a comic book style story telling including the end game credits.  All which were kinda boring especially when all I was looking for was more twin stick shooting.  Pretty fun and worth a shot if you have friends coming over for some couch coop action.

reviewText: This game might be one of the greatest disappointments I've had the displeasure of enduring.  Naturally I bought the game due to my love for the Ghostbusters franchise, but the gameplay is imbalanced and boring.  Between levels you are forced to endure a comic which isn't bad, but it does take too much time.  I do say forced, despite the option of skipping the comic, but there is an achievement for sitting though them all.\n\nOn the plus side I do like the design of the game.  Though the level design was repetitive with you revisiting the same map on a few occasions I still enjoyed the atmosphere the production team created.  My main complaint about the game is the movement.  The playable characters move very slowly, and the game play consists of you and the other three members of your team being swarmed by fast moving specters.  These apparitions are also capable of shooting swarms of projectiles and can cause your movement to be slowed, creating a situation where your death is inevitable.  So common is your death in this game it seems to me that the developers tried to compensate by incorporating your innumerable demises into the overall gameplay.  This combined with the moronic AI for CPU players makes the game nearly impossible to complete on your own.  Why don't you get your friends to play with you?" might be the obvious question
recommended: I am the only person I know dumb enough to spend money on Something with as bad a rating as this pile of ♥♥♥♥♥ merely because it's a product license I like.\n\nBottom line
hoursPlayed: I would not recommend this game as it is to anyone.\n"

reviewText:
When there's something strange in the neighbourhood Who Ya Gonna Call?

Ghostbusters: Sanctum of Slime is to Ghostbusters: The Videogame is kinda like what Ghostbusters 2 was to Ghostbusters.

Imagine your Atari, you had just release Ghostbusters: The Videogame and it was successful, so what do you do? The Answer: you release a twin stick shooter as a somewhat sorta sequel to it called Ghostbusters: Sanctum of Slime.

The problem with that is it's a complete letdown, first of all the characters are all different, they're not even the Extreme Ghostbusters of the 90s. Second like I mentioned above it's a Twin Stick shooter, they don't work that well with Keyboard and Mouse, so you must play it with a controller. Third, there no online co-op so if you don't have a friend or four additional controllers your left playing the game with the A.I. companions, who would rather revive you than shoot the boss with 1% health left.

The game feels more like a cash-in for another Ghostbusters game because the 2009 one was so successful, like Ghostbusters 2 it lacks the magic and charm of it's predecessor. I only mildly recommend this to those who are obsessed with all things Ghostbusters (like myself)

Also for the the longest time this was the only Ghostbusters game on Steam, thank goodness the 2009 on made it back, so get that one instead.

PS. Happy 30th Anniversary Ghostbusters

reviewText:
‘Ghostbusters: Sanctum of Slime’ -- or ‘Ghostbusters: We didn’t even try to make a good game, because it’ll sell like any Ghostbusters-licenced product does...’

Don’t buy it, especially if you just want it for single-player. Imagine anything that could be wrong with a top-down shooter and you’ll probably will find it in this game: constantly changing camera angles; non-customisable controls; stupid AI; super-stupid enemy design -- especially for bosses [more health + one-hit kills = more challenge, right?!]; weapon design that’s a joke... Let alone the blatant disregard for the licence it’s based on.

It’s like the developers were kidnapped and forced to create this atrocity. They are probably trying to communicate this fact, or otherwise the title couldn’t be shortened to ‘Ghostbusters: SOS’. Subliminal messaging at its best.

reviewText:
This is the 2nd or 3rd best Ghostbusters Video game (fanmade and otherwise) I've ever seen!  And it just ain't good enough.

Tough game, I don't recommend it.  The top down style is okay, the AI controlled ghostbusters are not.

I don't think it is a big deal that you don't play as one of the original 4 ghostbusters.  If they do Ghostbusters 3 with an all-female cast, are people going to say it is terrible because we won't see one of the 3 surviving 60+ year old Ghostbusters alumni getting slimed?  No, we are going to say that it is terrible because they will try to glossy it up with sex appeal or something else that doesn't belong in the Ghostbusting universe (except it was kind of funny when Ray got head from that vapour).

Back to my thoughts on the game...well frankly I'm already bored of thinking about it.  That's just the problem, there is no attachment to the characters or much of a storyline, it just doesn't capture the spirit (no pun intended) of Ghostbusters.  This is more like Smash TV, just shoot and dodge and move on.

Something a little closer to the Nintendo DS version of the Ghostbusters game would have been good.  Actually getting to drive (and control) ECTO 1 would be good.  Using traps to catch the ghosts would be good.  Earn money to use to research new gear.

Frankly it isn't even really worth the time to write anym..

reviewText:
To be honest, my hopes were not high when I picked up this game on sale. It looked pretty simple and pretty bloody ugly but surely it'd be worth a quid or so? The game powered up and there was the sweet, sweet sound of the Ghostbusters theme, my eyes teared with joy and I danced. Hopes were raised and then instantly dashed as soon as I started playing it.

It seem that the theme was what they spent 90% of their budget on because it sure as hell wasn't the game itself. It fails at the most basic of tasks with the weapons more often than not completely missing where your crosshair was aiming, this is especially noticeable on the blue plasma gun thing. Yes that's right they decided to give you fancy new weapons. They are utter ♥♥♥♥, but they are there. The other alternate weapon to the classic proton pack is a spread fire yellow monstrosity that is about as effective as attacking ghosts with a wet sock.

What makes it worse is you don’t even get to ignore these less than stellar bonus weapons as for some bizarre reason the game devs decided that busting ghosts required us to play a fun, fun game (read: entirely not fun) of match the colours. You see ghosts have decided to bring out their summer range of ghostly glows and are colour coded in Red, Yellow & Blue. Red can only be slain with your proton pack, yellow is reserved for the wet sock gun and blue is for you misaligned plasma weapon.

All this high octane 'gameplay' is spread over something around 11 levels. Only there is only 5 maps (excluding the last boss battle map) so you play through the dull selection of maps, Hotel, Sewer, Graveyard etc. only to have the pleasure of playing them again, with minor changes. Not that'll you notice any of the changes because they are still uglier than a pitbulls ♥♥♥♥♥♥. Special mention goes the to the half on rails shooter sections in which you are driven around on the back of ECTO-4WD, a 4x4 version of the iconic Ghostbusters car only this time driven by what can only assume is a London cabbie off his face of crack. Just when you think things can't get worse the final level before you are faced with the uninspiring giant demon last boss baddie is a map where you get to fight each of the bosses you have defeated one by one. OH FUN!

Maybe things wouldn't be so bad if the AI was apparently programmed to act like baby ducklings. Baby ducklings with highly dangerous weaponry and suicidal tendencies. When they aren't all trying to hug each other for warmth (while unleashing proton beams into each other faces) they are pinning you to the wall so the ghosts get to chew your face off, or my favourite, using the wrong gun to attack ghost. See, even the AI thinks it's a ♥♥♥♥ idea to have colour coded ghosts! It probably wouldn’t be as bad if every ghost on the screen seems to target the human player, leaving you sprinting around with a comical conga line of monsters behind you while the AI 'busters discusses amongst themselves the finer points of window licking.

Now I suppose this could be solved by having three friends play alongside you, which I suppose is true. Yanno, if you have some friends you really, really hate because they won't be friends with you after enduring this. Thank Christ it’s short.
voteText: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
In singleplayer this game is terrible.

You're part of a team of four but get the aggro of literally about 95% of all monsters. Meaning you are often forced to run around without shooting as a decoy (shooting slows you down which kills you with so many attackers), watching your AI mates lose the current fight over and over. Pointless. Is this even a game?

The only thing that makes this a Ghostbusters title is the famous ghostbusters song playing during the main menu. You don't play the original four Ghostbusters but some generic clowns. You drive around in an army jeep instead of the Ghostbusters mobile. The weapons have three modes, only one looking kind of like in the original movie

reviewText:
Most Disapointing Game of the Year 2011.I'm a huge Ghostbusters fan, so when I heard about a new Ghostbusters game with MULTIPLAYER, I nearly busted a slimer in my pants. But then, I got the game.

THERE IS NO MULTIPLAYER IN THIS GAME

Don't believe what the store says, I repeat:

THERE IS NO MULTIPLAYER IN THIS GAME

Someone got this game as a gift to me and I was incredibly excited about the prospect of busting ghosts with them. Words can not express how let down I was by this game. This is a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ port for Xbox live, they took a cheap ♥♥♥♥ing top down shooter and slapped Ghostbusters on it.

Game features:
-A horrible Ghostbusters comic that reads like bad fanfiction
-No voice acting, not a single spoken line
-AI that makes L4D2 bots look like Deep Blue
-Only 12 catchable ghosts.
-Unending waves of ghost fodder that you don't catch
-Crushed dreams.

Don't buy this game. People should be paid to endure this game. It's terrible.
